CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 23, 1957, pg. 11 reads:"African Children Baptized - Bishop E. C. Hatcher baptized Alice and Alma, the little daughters of Mr. and Mrs. Lonnie Polk, at Trinity AME Church. Mrs. Alma A. Polk, director of the Young People's Department of the AME Church, brought the children from Africa when she visited Bishop Hatcher at Monrovia in March, 1955.  Assisting Bishop Hatcher is Dr. Augustus C. Sumpter of St. James AME Church, Pittsburgh.  The Bishop has hands on the head of the children.  Mrs. Polk is holding Alma.  The aides, dressed in white, are Mmes. Mattie Spencer, Sallie Tranham [Traynham] and Laura White.  A large group of Mrs. Polk's friends witnessed the solemn occasion. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Bishop E. C. Hatcher and Dr. Augustus C. Sumpter performing baptism on Alma Polk and Alice Polk, with Alma Polk wearing dark suit, and Mattie Spencer, Sallie Traynham and Laura White looking on, in Trinity AME Church
